stack writes:
> We've not played with running mutliple crawls concurrently within the 
> one JVM instance. Hardest thing would be making the UI work with other 
> than one job at a time.  If UI wasn't needed, there'd be some wrestling 
> initially to make sure each crawl had its own config. and didn't share 
> resources, but thereafter, it shouldn't be hard to get it going.

No, not a single instance.

Right now I have n copies of the heritrix distribution, each one
started in its own instance with its own port and authentication
information.

Rather than do this, I'd like to have a single copy of the
distribution, which I start in n separate JVM instances, but
configured completely by the properties file. In particular the
location of the jobs directory for each one needs to be set.
